00028 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00029 
00030 
00031 //
00032 // Base class for all IRC crypt engines
00033 // These intend to encrypt plain text into something
00034 // that can be sent through the IRC protocol...
00035 // so it should not contain NULL, CR, LF and other
00036 // similar stuff...
00037 //
00038 
00039 
00040 #include "kvi_qstring.h"
00041 #include "kvi_string.h"
00042 #include "kvi_heapobject.h"
00043 #include "kvi_pointerhashtable.h"
00044 
00045 #include <QObject>
00046 
00047 #ifdef COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00048         class KviCryptEngine;
00049 
00050         typedef KviCryptEngine * (*crypt_engine_allocator_func)();
00051         typedef void (*crypt_engine_deallocator_func)(KviCryptEngine *);
00052 #endif //COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00053 
00054         // we must include this declaration to make moc happy even
00055         // if we're not compiling the crypt support
00056 
00057         class KVILIB_API KviCryptEngine : public QObject, public KviHeapObject
00058         {
00059                 Q_OBJECT
00060                 friend class KviCryptEngineManager;
00061         public:
00062                 KviCryptEngine();
00063                 virtual ~KviCryptEngine();
00064 
00065 #ifdef COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00066         private:
00067                 crypt_engine_deallocator_func m_deallocFunc;    // this is accessed by KviCryptEngineManager only
00068                 QString                       m_szLastError;
00069                 int                           m_iMaxEncryptLen;
00070         public:
00071                 void setMaxEncryptLen(int m){ m_iMaxEncryptLen = m; };
00072                 int maxEncryptLen(){ return m_iMaxEncryptLen; };
00073                 virtual bool init(const char * encKey,int encKeyLen,const char * decKey,int decKeyLen);
00074                 //
00075                 // Encrypts utf8 plainText and returns the encrypted
00076                 // data in outBuffer. The encrypted data must be
00077                 // suitable for sending thru an IRC (eventually DCC
00078                 // that is less restrictive) connection and must be utf8 encoded: so
00079                 // no NULL, CR and LF in the output.
00080                 // 0x01 should be also avoided since
00081                 // it is the CTCP delimiter.
00082                 // Converting the result in a HEX string
00083                 // is a good trick...also Base64 could be used.
00084                 // Should return false in case of an error.
00085                 // Theoretically we could allow NULLs in plainText
00086                 // but this is not the case of KVIrc.
00087                 //
00088                 enum EncryptResult { Encrypted, Encoded, EncryptError };
00089                 virtual EncryptResult encrypt(const char * plainText,KviStr &outBuffer);
00090                 //
00091                 // Decrypts the utf8 data in inBuffer and puts the decrypted utf8
00092                 // stuff in plainText. inBuffer is the thingie
00093                 // that we got from outBuffer of encrupt() so it
00094                 // follows the same rules.
00095                 // Should return false in case of error.
00096                 //
00097                 enum DecryptResult { DecryptOkWasEncrypted, DecryptOkWasEncoded, DecryptOkWasPlainText, DecryptError };
00098                 virtual DecryptResult decrypt(const char * inBuffer,KviStr &plainText);
00099                 //
00100                 // Returns the string containing the description
00101                 // of the last error or an empty string if there
00102                 // was no error after the last init() call.
00103                 //
00104                 const QString &lastError(){ return m_szLastError; };
00105         protected:
00106                 //
00107                 // The following two should have clear meaning
00108                 //
00109                 void clearLastError(){ m_szLastError = ""; };
00110                 void setLastError(const QString &err){ m_szLastError = err; };
00111 #endif //COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00112         };
00113 
00114 #ifdef COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00115         #define KVI_CRYPTENGINE_CAN_ENCRYPT 1
00116         #define KVI_CRYPTENGINE_CAN_DECRYPT 2
00117         #define KVI_CRYPTENGINE_WANT_ENCRYPT_KEY 4
00118         #define KVI_CRYPTENGINE_WANT_DECRYPT_KEY 8
00119 
00120         class KVILIB_API KviCryptEngineDescription : public KviHeapObject
00121         {
00122         public:
00123                 KviCryptEngineDescription(){};
00124                 virtual ~KviCryptEngineDescription(){};
00125         public:
00126                 QString                       m_szName;           // engine name
00127                 QString                       m_szDescription;    // details
00128                 QString                       m_szAuthor;         // algorithm author
00129                 int                           m_iFlags;           // properties
00130                 crypt_engine_allocator_func   m_allocFunc;        // engine allocator
00131                 crypt_engine_deallocator_func m_deallocFunc;      // deallocation function (if called from outside the origin module)
00132                 void                        * m_providerHandle;   // used to identify the provider module
00133         };
00134 
00135 
00136         class KVILIB_API KviCryptEngineManager
00137         {
00138         public:
00139                 KviCryptEngineManager();
00140                 virtual ~KviCryptEngineManager();
00141         private:
00142                 KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviCryptEngineDescription> * m_pEngineDict;
00143         public:
00144                 const KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviCryptEngineDescription> * engineDict(){ return m_pEngineDict; };
00145                 void registerEngine(KviCryptEngineDescription * d);
00146                 void unregisterEngine(const QString &szName);
00147                 void unregisterEngines(void * providerHandle);
00148                 //
00149                 // Allocates a crypt engine
00150                 // Please note that the engine may be deleted from outside
00151                 // so you'd better connect the "destroyed" signal
00152                 //
00153                 KviCryptEngine * allocateEngine(const QString &szName);
00154                 void deallocateEngine(KviCryptEngine * e);
00155         };

00157 #endif //COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
